Package org.fluidity.foundation

Utilities to support basic tasks.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Archives.Entry
    Selects and reads entries in a JAR file.
    Archives.Entry.Reader
    Reads one entry from an archive.
    Command.Function<R,P,E extends Throwable>
    Extends the Runnable concept to commands that can take some parameter, return some value, and throw some exception.
    Command.Job<E extends Throwable>
    Extends the Runnable concept to commands that can throw some exception.
    Command.Operation<P,E extends Throwable>
    Extends the Runnable concept to commands that can take some parameter and throw some exception.
    Command.Process<R,E extends Throwable>
    Extends the Runnable concept to commands that can return some value and throw some exception.
    Configuration<T>
    Dependency injected component configuration.
    Configuration.Query<R,P>
    Groups configuration queries to provide settings consistency.
    Deferred.Label
    A lazy-initialized label.
    Deferred.Reference<T>
    A reference to some object that is lazily instantiated.
    Generics.Parameters
    Works around http://bugs.sun.com/view_bug.do?bug_id=5087240.
    IOStreams.Output
    Byte array sink.
    Log<T>
    Log interface to use by dependency injected components.
    Methods.Selector<T>
    Allows the caller of Methods.get() to find a method without referring to it by name.
    Proxies.Identity<T>
    Provides object identity to some proxy.
    ServiceProviders.Log
    Provides means to emit log messages without having Log available.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Archives
    Convenience methods to work with Java archives.
    Archives.Cache
    Archives cache related functions.
    Archives.Nested
    Convenience methods to handle nested Java archives.
    ClassLoaders
    Utility methods related to class loaders.
    Command
    Namespace for the various extensions of the Runnable concept, including the possibility to throw checked exceptions.
    Deferred
    Lazy instantiation with or without thread safety.
    Exceptions
    A utility that allows propagation of checked exceptions through method calls that don't allow those checked exceptions thrown from inside.
    Exceptions.Tunnel
    Implements the actual exception wrapping / unwrapping functionality described at Exceptions.
    Generics
    Utility methods to access parameterized type information.
    IOStreams
    General I/O stream related convenience methods.
    Lists
    Utilities related to arrays.
    Lists.Delimited
    A string listing tool that makes working with a StringBuilder simpler when collecting list items.
    Methods
    Convenience methods on methods.
    NoLogFactory
    Log factory to produce loggers that gobble up messages.
    Proxies
    Convenience utilities concerning proxies.
    ServiceProviders
    Implements the Sun JDK service provider discovery.
    Strings
    Common string related utilities.
    Utility
    Abstract superclass that prevents instantiation of its subclasses.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    Configuration.PropertyException
    Adds a more descriptive error message to exceptions that occur while loading properties and converting them to settings.
    Exceptions.Wrapper
    An unchecked exception that wraps a checked exception.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    Configuration.Prefix
    Provides a component context for a Configuration dependency.
    Configuration.Property
    Annotates a configuration query method to specify what property to query, what default value to return if the property is not defined, and how to process list and map typed configuration values.

Package org.fluidity.foundation Description

Utilities to support basic tasks.

Fluid Tools Foundation offers a diverse set of tools to deal with frequent small tasks such as:

  • Configuration: injecting configuration as a dependency;
  • Logging: injecting a logger as a dependency;
  • DCL: Double-Checked Locking with volatile acquire/release semantics;
  • Class loading: working with class loaders;
  • Exceptions: working with checked exceptions;
  • Type parameters: working with generic type parameters;
  • Proxies: working with proxies;
  • IOStreams: working with I/O streams;
  • Methods: reflecting methods in a refactoring friendly manner;
  • Strings: converting classes and objects, and arrays thereof, to text;
  • Lists: array related utilities;
  • Archives: working with JAR archives, including an URL handler for JAR archives nested in other JAR archives, with convenience methods to manipulate nested JAR URLs.
